column1: Thank you to the folks at Russell Medical Center in Alex City for having me today. Hospitals like Russell have been hard at work on the front lines against Covid-19. #AL03 https://t.co/BPMcKWnYP1

Our Defense sector has stepped up to support Americans during the Covid crisis and any future response bill should reflect that. Thanks @mactxpress and @repkaygranger for your leadership. https://t.co/64phiYp0hp

I was pleased to cosponsor H.R. 6829 which authorizes a bilateral grant program with our ally Israel.  It matches funds from both govs to develop health technologies personalized medicine & data in regards to COVID-19.  It will also help Israel lessen any cooperation with China.

I was pleased H.R. 7010 the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) Flexibility Act passed the House today with my strong support.  The PPP has been a lifeline of support to so many businesses across East Alabama and the country during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Starting today any farmer impacted by COVID-19 can apply for financial relief through Coronavirus Food Assistance Program here:  https://t.co/bcd1W5FJWa #Ag #AL03

-Approved AL as 7th state to operate the Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) a new program authorized by the Families First Coronavirus Act (FFCRA) which provides assistance to families of children eligible for free or reduced-price meals dealing with school closures.

Under @realDonaldTrump USDA has: -Announced Coronavirus Food Asst Program 4 farmers/ranchers/consumers in #Alabama in response 2 COVID-19. $19B will provide $16B in direct support based on actual losses for ag producers & $3B in purchases of fresh produce/dairy/meat https://t.co/mYd77QnxD3

-Allocated $14.4 M+ in DOJ funds to AL to assist State & local govt response to COVID-19. This includes $9.6 M+ in funding to State & $4.8 M+ to local govts -Allocated $131.2 M+ in Federal Transit Admin funds to help AL public transpo systems respond to the challenges of COVID-19

Under @realDonaldTrump HUD DOJ and DOT have: -Made $41.4 M+ in COVID-19 funding available to #Alabama housing voucher grantees -Provided FHA multi-family borrowers in AL & across the nation with forbearance for up to 3 mo. if they agree not to evict tenants during that period https://t.co/zz4OODsiyA

-Delivered 152412 N-95 masks 362580 surgical masks 59699 medical gowns 1939 coveralls 72922 face shields & 305359 gloves from the Strategic National Stockpile to AL -Obligated $18.7 M for COVID-19 Emergency Management response efforts in AL
-Issued over 1.3 M Economic Impact Payments totaling more than $2.4 B to individuals in Alabama -Issued $1.9 B to the State of Alabama for Coronavirus-related Expenses Relief
For all of our farmers!  ICYMI:  Info from ALFA on COVID-19 https://t.co/17yg9p1kzs
Coronavirus Update:  Where We Go From Here https://t.co/bVPxmEMJeY
Alabama needs every test we have- help us keep COVID-19 tests for those who need it most by following the guidelines below! https://t.co/beaS1Lt72D
Reminder to follow this guidance from the CDC and The White House as we work to slow the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/Ml0XwN5VV8

Red Cross urges healthy individuals to give blood amid #coronavirus concerns. Low donor turnout could hurt U.S. blood supply. Learn more and schedule an appointment if you're feeling healthy and well at https://t.co/9P4NFwoKzn #COVID19 https://t.co/8q2X3JungN
Please continue to visit this site to stay updated on the COVID-19 situation in Alabama.  https://t.co/7g8AUV24FK
If you are a small business affected by COVID-19 check out guidance from the SBA here:  https://t.co/USv8bO7t2S #AL03

Interviewing with Peter from Gray TV this week to update folks across #AL03 on the flawed plan to bring Americans exposed to Coronavirus to the CDP and how President Trump stopped it. https://t.co/sE7UOwwvlQ

Thank you to Joey at WEIS for the interview today to discuss Coronavirus  and how to make sure our country is prepared.  I appreciate President Trump’s leadership on this. #AL03 https://t.co/BS8DdwrmsV

Thank you to Sophie from ABC News for the interview this week.  I shared with her the story from beginning to end of the flawed plan of bringing Americans exposed to Coronavirus to the CDP. #AL03 https://t.co/NVzUunZjfV

In the past 24 hours I have spoken to @realdonaldtrump twice and just spoke with Secretary Azar. The plan to house the Americans exposed to Coronavirus at the CDP in Anniston has thankfully been CANCELLED.

Earlier this evening I spoke w/ @realDonaldTrump. He agreed with me that the decision by the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to house those Americans exposed to Coronavirus (COVID-19) at the Center for Domestic Preparedness (CDP) in Anniston is the wrong decision.
